update.description:
* add functions to access opengl texture id
* add test

This is needed by ign-gui gz11 branch.

‌
update.title: Glrendertexture gz11

content.raw: ogre2 is WIP so let’s not let it block this PR.
content.html: ogre2 is WIP so let’s not let it block this PR.

content.raw: Approving so we can get this in soon, we can always iterate later. It doesn't look like it breaks anything to me.
content.html: Approving so we can get this in soon, we can always iterate later. It doesn't look like it breaks anything to me.

content.raw: Regarding the last point, repaints don't seem to mess the rest of the screen, see [this PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/129/gz11-resize-scene/diff)
content.html: Regarding the last point, repaints don't seem to mess the rest of the screen, see this PR

content.raw:
we found out that having  both ogre 2.1 and ogre 1.x will cause test failure. This is something I need to work on for the ogre2 integration work.

when using just default `gz11` branches and no ogre 2.1 installed, the tests pass for me
content.html:
we found out that having both ogre 2.1 and ogre 1.x will cause test failure. This is something I need to work on for the ogre2 integration work.

when using just default gz11 branches and no ogre 2.1 installed, the tests pass for me

content.raw:
A few outstanding issues with the integration of this branch in ign-gui, which I'm not sure come from here or from `ignition::gui::plugins::Scene3D`:

* When opening multiple cameras to the same scene, the background of one of them has the correct color and all others have a black background
* The plugin doesn't die on shutdown and we need to manually kill it
* We still have no example when the scene is continuously printed to the screen, we only have a fixes camera angle looking at a grid. I'd like to have something continuously painted to be sure that works, it could be mouse orbiting, window resizing(?), or something actually moving in the scene.
content.html:
A few outstanding issues with the integration of this branch in ign-gui, which I'm not sure come from here or from ignition::gui::plugins::Scene3D:

  • When opening multiple cameras to the same scene, the background of one of them has the correct color and all others have a black background
  • The plugin doesn't die on shutdown and we need to manually kill it
  • We still have no example when the scene is continuously printed to the screen, we only have a fixes camera angle looking at a grid. I'd like to have something continuously painted to be sure that works, it could be mouse orbiting, window resizing(?), or something actually moving in the scene.

content.raw: Okay, this was a mercurial mistake on my part, I missed a commit.
content.html: Okay, this was a mercurial mistake on my part, I missed a commit.

content.raw: Consider adding `override` to all overrides (at least the ones added in this PR)
content.html: Consider adding override to all overrides (at least the ones added in this PR)

content.raw: I have both installed, I’m going to coordinate with @iche033 on his `ign-cmake` PR, which should  fix this.
content.html: I have both installed, I’m going to coordinate with @iche033 on his ign-cmake PR, which should fix this.

content.raw: Ahh. I don’t have Ogre2 installed right now. Do you have both ogre1.9 and ogre2 installed?
content.html: Ahh. I don’t have Ogre2 installed right now. Do you have both ogre1.9 and ogre2 installed?

content.raw: Actually, it’s probably an issue with \`ign-cmake\`.  FindOGRE shouldn’t return versions >= 2.0
content.html: Actually, it’s probably an issue with `ign-cmake`. FindOGRE shouldn’t return versions >= 2.0

content.raw: Ah, it appears, that it’s grabbing OGRE2 rather than 1.9, so there aren’t any engines registered when the test runs.  This is probably okay?
content.html: Ah, it appears, that it’s grabbing OGRE2 rather than 1.9, so there aren’t any engines registered when the test runs. This is probably okay?

content.raw: We can’t run tests in pipelines right now because a valid display doesn’t exist.
content.html: We can’t run tests in pipelines right now because a valid display doesn’t exist.

content.raw: The `[Err]` messages are expected. The segmentation fault is not expected. Can you get a backtrace?
content.html: The [Err] messages are expected. The segmentation fault is not expected. Can you get a backtrace?

content.raw:
The only reason I ask is that on my machine I get a test failure in the `UNIT_RenderingIface_TEST`  

    [==========] Running 2 tests from 1 test case.
    [----------] Global test environment set-up.
    [----------] 2 tests from RenderingIfaceTest
    [ RUN      ] RenderingIfaceTest.GetEngine
    [Err] [RenderEngineManager.cc:95] No render-engine registered with name: no_such_engine
    [Err] [RenderEngineManager.cc:107] Invalid render-engine index: 1000000
    [       OK ] RenderingIfaceTest.GetEngine (0 ms)
    [ RUN      ] RenderingIfaceTest.RegisterEngine
    [Err] [RenderEngineManager.cc:107] Invalid render-engine index: 0
    [1]    22369 segmentation fault (core dumped)  ./bin/UNIT_RenderingIface_TEST

‌
content.html:

content.raw: Are we intentionally not running tests in the pipeline?
content.html: Are we intentionally not running tests in the pipeline?
